entry.title: 070 - Why ME/CFS "fatigue" is not normal fatigue

media:group.media:title: 070 - Why ME/CFS "fatigue" is not normal fatigue
media:group.media:description: How I use lipopolysaccharide (endotoxin) for researching chronic pain and fatigue. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 069 - Can saline infusions help ME/CFS?

media:group.media:title: 069 - Can saline infusions help ME/CFS?
media:group.media:description:
A small, open-label clinical trial of intravenous saline for dysautonomia in myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). I'm not sure if the paper is open-access, but it is here: https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/neurology/articles/10.3389/fneur.2025.1601599/full
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 068 - New results from a (very large) ME/CFS genetics study!

media:group.media:title: 068 - New results from a (very large) ME/CFS genetics study!
media:group.media:description:
The article is available on the "preprint" link on this page: https://www.research.ed.ac.uk/en/publications/initial-findings-from-the-decodeme-genome-wide-association-study- This is from the DecodeME study.
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: Upcoming conference on Long-COVID treatments!

media:group.media:title: Upcoming conference on Long-COVID treatments!
media:group.media:description: RECOVER conference September 9th and 10th on Long-COVID clinical trials. The registration link is: https://web.cvent.com/event/2e8bf8c3-8714-4524-b04f-e089822fdb27/regProcessStep1:bb88b672-e547-461f-95df-af0938bf10ef?bbeml=tp-dnwJc27W802R9IacBWspeg.j7D72y9iPS0OnvHp0LuJDXg.rPJ5fC0QjcEmNmf19vqd7sA.lHNd8CUtvNECRvyXgKjVbAw - Jarred Younger #Long-COVID #clinicaltrials #science #medicine #conference #shorts

entry.title: 067 - New results: The ME/CFS brain is inflamed

media:group.media:title: 067 - New results: The ME/CFS brain is inflamed
media:group.media:description:
Here are new positron emission tomography (PET) results showing abnormal microglia activation in myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). The study was funded by the National Institutes of Health (NIH).
Brain images come from the Harvard Whole Brain Atlas: https://www.med.harvard.edu/aanlib/cases/caseNA/pb9.htm
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 066 - New paper: The top treatments for ME/CFS and Long-COVID

media:group.media:title: 066 - New paper: The top treatments for ME/CFS and Long-COVID
media:group.media:description:
This newly-released paper highlights the treatments reported as most beneficial by almost 4000 ME/CFS and Long-COVID sufferers. The open-access paper is here: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40627388/
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 065 - Elevated brain lactate in ME/CFS chronic fatigue (converging evidence)

media:group.media:title: 065 - Elevated brain lactate in ME/CFS chronic fatigue (converging evidence)
media:group.media:description:
A new paper is out using a powerful 7 Tesla magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scanner to find brain abnormalities in myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). The open-access paper is here: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41380-025-03108-8
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 064 - The brain's hidden system (the glymphatic system)

media:group.media:title: 064 - The brain's hidden system (the glymphatic system)
media:group.media:description:
The glymphatic system uses a surprising process to drain waste and toxins out of the brain. Increasing evidence suggests this system can fail, causing toxins to build up in the brain. You can find the paper here, but it may not be open-access: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40579044/
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 063 - Consenting finished for our remote clinical trial!

media:group.media:title: 063 - Consenting finished for our remote clinical trial!
media:group.media:description: We consented the final participant for our resveratrol, stinging nettle, and curcumin remote clinical trial! This is a short video giving the update and thanking my awesome research team. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 062 - Orexin and chronic fatigue

media:group.media:title: 062 - Orexin and chronic fatigue
media:group.media:description: Orexin is critical for wakefulness. There is an untested hypothesis that chronic fatigue syndrome involves disrupted brain orexin activity. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 061 - Low dose rapamycin for ME/CFS

media:group.media:title: 061 - Low dose rapamycin for ME/CFS
media:group.media:description:
Here is a new (pre-print) paper from the non-profit group Simmaron Research testing rapamycin for myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). The pre-print is available here: https://www.researchsquare.com/article/rs-6596158/v1
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 060 - Testing for poor blood-brain barrier integrity

media:group.media:title: 060 - Testing for poor blood-brain barrier integrity
media:group.media:description: Many people are wondering if their pain, fatigue, or cognitive issues may be due to a problem with their blood-brain barrier. Here are the two main tests that are used to test for that problem. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 059 - Ozempic and Wegovy should NOT be used for chronic pain and fatigue

media:group.media:title: 059 - Ozempic and Wegovy should NOT be used for chronic pain and fatigue
media:group.media:description: There is growing scientific evidence that GLP-1 receptor agonists reduce a wide range of neuroinflammatory and neurodegenerative disorders. While the animal-model results are intriguing, it is too risky for individuals to take these drugs for chronic pain and fatigue. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 058 - The 8 clinical trials we need to run now

media:group.media:title: 058 - The 8 clinical trials we need to run now
media:group.media:description: I have a long list of treatments to try for chronic pain, fatigue, and cognitive disorders. Here are the 8 at the top of that long list. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 057 - Pesticides and low brain choline

media:group.media:title: 057 - Pesticides and low brain choline
media:group.media:description: Some new findings from our lab show a link between pesticide exposure in the Persian Gulf War, and low brain choline 30 years later. This is a possible cause for Gulf War Illness.

entry.title: 056 - Clinical trial article retracted

media:group.media:title: 056 - Clinical trial article retracted
media:group.media:description: An article on using prednisone for Gulf War Illness was recently retracted. The article may be found at the below links. - Jarred Younger https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11999155/ https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0322822 file:///C:/Users/younger/Downloads/journal.pone.0322822.pdf

entry.title: 055 - Focused ultrasound reduces chronic pain

media:group.media:title: 055 - Focused ultrasound reduces chronic pain
media:group.media:description: You can get the open-access paper at: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/39073370/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 054 - Reaching deep into the brain

media:group.media:title: 054 - Reaching deep into the brain
media:group.media:description: Transcranial focused ultrasound (tFUS) is now a promising treatment modality for chronic pain and fatigue conditions. I briefly discuss my plans on using these devices. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: A scan that measures your brain fuel

media:group.media:title: A scan that measures your brain fuel
media:group.media:description: A technique called 31P magnetic resonance spectroscopy allows us to measure how much critical adenosine triphosphate (ATP) you have in your brain. This scan may show us why people with ME/CFS have limited resources for sustained physical or mental activity. - Jarred Younger Thumbnail photo from: https://www.vecteezy.com/photo/11378881-low-fuel-gauge-on-car-dashboard-close-up

entry.title: 052 - Why most people are excluded from clinical trials

media:group.media:title: 052 - Why most people are excluded from clinical trials
media:group.media:description: I usually don't talk about the mechanics of scientific research, but I thought some of you would be interested in this aspect of clinical trials. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 051 - What is this lactate in the ME/CFS brain?

media:group.media:title: 051 - What is this lactate in the ME/CFS brain?
media:group.media:description: Sorry for being gone for so long! Here are some new analyses from my lab that show elevated lactate in the myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) brain. I believe these results show that ME/CFS involves brain inflammation. You can find the article mentioned in the video here: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30617782/ The brain images presented use this tool: https://neurotorium.org/tool/brain-atlas/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 050 - Why new medication might not help chronic pain

media:group.media:title: 050 - Why new medication might not help chronic pain
media:group.media:description: A short discussion on the use of FDA-approved medication JOURNAVX (suzetrigine) for chronic pain.

entry.title: 049 - Will low-dose NALMEFENE work better than low-dose NALTREXONE for reducing brain inflammation?

media:group.media:title: 049 - Will low-dose NALMEFENE work better than low-dose NALTREXONE for reducing brain inflammation?
media:group.media:description: Here is a quick update on my proposal to test low-dose nalmefene for myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). There is some evidence that nalmefene may work better than naltrexone in reducing brain inflammation. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 048 - Treating chronic low back pain with noninvasive vagus nerve stimulation

media:group.media:title: 048 - Treating chronic low back pain with noninvasive vagus nerve stimulation
media:group.media:description: Here is a new pilot clinical trial for managing chronic low back pain. You can find the full paper at: https://www.mdpi.com/2077-0383/13/24/7601 - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 047 - Intranasal antihistamines may prevent Long-COVID

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 047 - Intranasal antihistamines may prevent Long-COVID
media:group.media:description: Here is the link to the open-access paper. You should be able to access it by clicking on the PDF button: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11600942/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 046 - Does oxaloacetate reduce ME/CFS fatigue?

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 046 - Does oxaloacetate reduce ME/CFS fatigue?
media:group.media:description: New results from a ME/CFS clinical trial. You can find the complete paper at: https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/neurology/articles/10.3389/fneur.2024.1483876/full - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 045 - Can we filter ME/CFS and Long-COVID out of our blood (apheresis)?

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 045 - Can we filter ME/CFS and Long-COVID out of our blood (apheresis)?
media:group.media:description: Two new pilot studies indicate that therapeutic apheresis may be helpful in controlling ME/CFS and Long-COVID symptoms. The published report can be found at: https://www.thieme-connect.com/products/ejournals/abstract/10.1055/a-2445-8593 - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 044 - Inflammation and anxiety

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 044 - Inflammation and anxiety
media:group.media:description: After I did a video on inflammation causing depression, I was asked if inflammation can also cause anxiety. Here is the answer from work conducted by me and other research groups. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 043 - New paper published! Air quality affects pain and fatigue.

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 043 - New paper published! Air quality affects pain and fatigue.
media:group.media:description: Here is our new paper on air quality and chronic pain and fatigue. Just click the download button at: https://www.mdpi.com/1660-4601/21/12/1560 The real-time air quality map I used for this presentation can be found at: https://www2.purpleair.com/ . You can click on one of the map links on that page. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 042 - Cognition really is worse in ME/CFS

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 042 - Cognition really is worse in ME/CFS
media:group.media:description: A new scientific paper shows impaired cognitive functioning in ME/CFS. While this will not be a surprise to anyone with the condition, the study helps us understand the nature and extent of the problem. You can find the open access full paper here: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11565701/ The thumbnail image uses the Neurotorium brain atlas: https://neurotorium.org/tool/brain-atlas/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 041 - Thanks to all the Veteran research participants

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 041 - Thanks to all the Veteran research participants
media:group.media:description: It is Veterans Day in the U.S., and Armistice Day or Remembrance Day in many countries throughout the world. I thank my funders and research team for all their support, and in particular thank the Veteran research participants who give their time to help us discover new treatments. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 040 - We need to talk about C-Reactive Protein (CRP) a bit more

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 040 - We need to talk about C-Reactive Protein (CRP) a bit more
media:group.media:description: As promised, here are the new data on systemic inflammation in myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 039 - We need to talk about C-Reactive Protein (CRP)

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 039 - We need to talk about C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
media:group.media:description: C-Reactive Protein (CRP) is a sensitive marker of inflammation. I am presenting some new data on CRP elevations I see in chronic pain and fatigue conditions. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 038 - Update on clinical trials for pain, fatigue, and cognitive issues

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 038 - Update on clinical trials for pain, fatigue, and cognitive issues
media:group.media:description: Here is a quick update on our current clinical trials. Below are screening links for our psilocybin (for fibromyalgia) study and curcumin, stinging nettle, and resveratrol (for Gulf War Illness) study: Screening link for psilocybin and fibromyalgia study: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_20jbBUG5kx7bLBI?S=Y Screening link for botanicals and Gulf War Illness study: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7QBq7JNtdQxvjzo - Jarred

entry.title: 037 - NIH needs your Long-COVID treatment suggestions

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 037 - NIH needs your Long-COVID treatment suggestions
media:group.media:description: The National Institutes of Health's RECOVER-TLC (Researching COVID to Enhance Recovery - Treating Long COVID) initiative is collecting treatment ideas to prioritize for clinical trials. If you have experience with an intervention that helped Long-COVID, please submit the information at the site below: https://fnih.org/our-programs/accelerating-covid-19-therapeutic-interventions-vaccines-activ/recover-tlc-will-advance-long-covid-research/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 036 - Elevated adrenaline in ME/CFS

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 036 - Elevated adrenaline in ME/CFS
media:group.media:description: This recent meta-analysis found that individuals with myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) may have elevated adrenaline while people with fibromyalgia (FM) do not. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 035 - A new clinical trial for ME/CFS (LIFT)

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 035 - A new clinical trial for ME/CFS (LIFT)
media:group.media:description: The Open Medicine Foundation (OMF) has started a clinical trial of low dose naltrexone (LDN) and pyridostigmine bromide (PB) for myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS). In this video, I discuss the details and my impressions of the study design. More info can be found at the links below. The ClinicalTrials.gov site: https://clinicaltrials.gov/study/NCT06366724 The OMF signup page: https://www.omf.ngo/studyme/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 034 - My list of potential treatments to test

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 034 - My list of potential treatments to test
media:group.media:description: If you were curious about the compounds I plan to test for ME/CFS, FM, GWI, and Long-COVID, here is my full list! These are chemicals that may return microglia to their normal state and reverse chronic brain inflammation. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 033 - Updates from the 2024 Stanford ME/CFS Working Group

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 033 - Updates from the 2024 Stanford ME/CFS Working Group
media:group.media:description: The annual Stanford ME/CFS Working Group meeting concluded last week. In this meeting, researchers were able to share their preliminary results before public release. In this video, I give my observations on the state of the science. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 032 - A new clinical trial for fibromyalgia using EMDR

media:group.media:title: 032 - A new clinical trial for fibromyalgia using EMDR
media:group.media:description:
A new publication this week (not from my lab) shows eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) therapy may help fibromyalgia pain. I wanted to share my opinions on how confident we can be that the results are meaningful.
This is an open access paper: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38835548/
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 031 - Air Quality Can Affect Chronic Fatigue and Pain

media:group.media:title: 031 - Air Quality Can Affect Chronic Fatigue and Pain
media:group.media:description: Here are some new results from our lab showing poor air quality may increase ME/CFS (Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome) fatigue and pain. This report is being prepared by graduate student Chloe Jones and is being submitted for peer-review now. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 030 - Does ME/CFS involve low brain oxygen?

media:group.media:title: 030 - Does ME/CFS involve low brain oxygen?
media:group.media:description:
Some brand new data from my lab using a cerebral perfusion scan to detect low brain oxygen. This scan is being used to determine (or rule out) poor brain oxygen in myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS).
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 029 - We need research on severe ME/CFS now

media:group.media:title: 029 - We need research on severe ME/CFS now
media:group.media:description:
25% of myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME/CFS) sufferers reported being homebound, and 4% report being bedridden. Research is urgently needed to better understand these severe cases of ME/CFS.
Below are links to the two open-access articles I mention in the video: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8535418/ https://www.mdpi.com/2227-9032/9/2/106
- Jarred Younger

entry.title: 028 - New findings: more evidence of poor oxygen perfusion in the brain.

media:group.media:title: 028 - New findings: more evidence of poor oxygen perfusion in the brain.
media:group.media:description: We seeing high levels of lactate and low levels of choline in the brains of Gulf War Illness sufferers. This quick update covers our new analyses and why the may be important to those with chronic pain, fatigue, and cognitive issues. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 027 - New lab results - low brain oxygen in chronic disease

media:group.media:title: 027 - New lab results - low brain oxygen in chronic disease
media:group.media:description:
Here are brand new results from a recent brain study we conducted. We found reduced oxygen circulation in the brains of people with Gulf War Illness. We are also analyzing individuals with ME/CFS and fibromyalgia.
You can find the 7 Tesla brain images at: https://histopath.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu
Jarred Younger

entry.title: 026 - What clinical trials are happening now?

media:group.media:title: 026 - What clinical trials are happening now?
media:group.media:description:
Clinicaltrials.gov is the official registry of human treatment studies. This video is a quick introduction to using the online tool to find out what trials are happening around you now. - Jarred Younger
www.clinicaltrials.gov

entry.title: 025 - How a virus damages our sense of smell.

media:group.media:title: 025 - How a virus damages our sense of smell.
media:group.media:description: Many people are concerned about the loss of their sense of smell that persists long after a SARS-CoV-2 infection. I want to explain how this anosmia occurs, and how it likely resolves over time. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 024 - Can French maritime pine bark help pain and fatigue?

media:group.media:title: 024 - Can French maritime pine bark help pain and fatigue?
media:group.media:description: Here are the results from a small pilot study I conducted on French maritime pine bark (Pycnogenol) for Gulf War Illness, with a particular focus on chronic pain/fatigue. You can find the full-text of the paper here: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33802272/ - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 023 - Inflammation causes depression
022 - Resveratrol for inflammatory body pain
021 - The brain's inflammation thermostat
020 - Research priorities for the second half of 2024
019 - Stinging nettle for chronic pain
018 - Green light therapy for chronic pain
017 - Remote Clinical Trial Update
016 - Could a fecal transfer abolish your chronic pain and fatigue?
015 - Why the microglia have turned against you

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 015 - Why the microglia have turned against you
media:group.media:description: Pathogens, environmental exposures, medications, and your physical and mental states are all potential sensitizers of microglia. In this video, I cover the most likely triggers of chronic brain inflammation. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 014 - When glia are the bad guys

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 014 - When glia are the bad guys
media:group.media:description: I believe microglia are the primary culprit behind fibromyalgia, ME/CFS, Gulf War Illness, Long-COVID, and other chronic pain and fatigue disorders. Here is a quick video on what I am trying to do to fix the problem. - Jarred Younger Here is a link to the "Glia as the bad guys" paper: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1857294/

entry.title: 013 - Dextronaltrexone for Chronic Pain and Fatigue

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 013 - Dextronaltrexone for Chronic Pain and Fatigue
media:group.media:description: Here is a quick update about my efforts to test dextronaltrexone in chronic pain, fatigue, and cognitive disorders related to brain inflammation. This substance has never been trialed in humans, and I want to tell you why it needs to be prioritized. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 012 - Good News from the FDA - Time to Start Scanning!

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 012 - Good News from the FDA - Time to Start Scanning!
media:group.media:description: We have been given the green light for our new scan tracking leukocyte infiltration of the brain. We can now run the first-ever patient! I wanted to share the exciting news. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 011 - Why fractalkine is important in chronic pain and fatigue

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 011 - Why fractalkine is important in chronic pain and fatigue
media:group.media:description: I'm presenting results from a new study we published showing fractalkine is abnormal in fibromyalgia. You can obtain the full article at the link below. This study was funded by the American Fibromyalgia Syndrome Association (AFSA). - Jarred Younger https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10679487/pdf/main.pdf

entry.title: 010 - The Strangest Experiment I Ever Conducted

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 010 - The Strangest Experiment I Ever Conducted
media:group.media:description: This is a story about the first experiment I ever conducted, which was also the strangest experiment I ever conducted. It is called "Explanations of the Staring Phenomenon".

entry.title: 009 - When a grant is rejected

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 009 - When a grant is rejected
media:group.media:description: A quick update from the lab. A large remote clinical trial grant we proposed for funding was rejected. This study was on low-dose naltrexone (LDN) and cannabidiol (CBD) for Gulf War Illness treatment. If you want to hear a bit about how I feel about rejected grants and how I handle them, check out the video. While this news is disappointing, we fortunately have more accepted grants than rejected ones, and this is just part of the highly competitive process. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 008 - An important change from local to remote clinical trials

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 008 - An important change from local to remote clinical trials
media:group.media:description: Here's a brief update on my recent shift from traditional clinical trials to remote clinical trials in which individuals can participate from anywhere in the United States. I already have an ongoing remote trial for Gulf War Illness and hope to expand to fibromyalgia, Long-COVID, and ME/CFS. This remote approach is not common, but is being embraced by an increasing number of labs. I am excited that this change will give people the opportunity to participate who never could before. - Jarred Younger I have only one remote trial right now, and that is for Gulf War Illness. The link for that study is: https://sites.uab.edu/younger/gwi/

entry.title: 007 - Detecting neuroinflammation with brain imaging

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 007 - Detecting neuroinflammation with brain imaging
media:group.media:description: Here is one of our recent studies using brain imaging to detect neuroinflammation in fibromyalgia. You should be able to download the entire article for free at one of the links below. - Jarred Younger https://journals.lww.com/pain/fulltext/2023/10000/evidence_of_neuroinflammation_in_fibromyalgia.14.aspx https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10502894/

entry.title: 006 - Simple blood tests to detect inflammation

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 006 - Simple blood tests to detect inflammation
media:group.media:description: I get asked quite often how someone can find out if they have chronic inflammation. Here are 8 blood tests that your physician can order. If the test results show abnormalities, it is possible that your chronic pain, fatigue, or cognitive issues are due to sustained inflammation.

entry.title: 005 - The National Institutes of Health ME/CFS Roadmap

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 005 - The National Institutes of Health ME/CFS Roadmap
media:group.media:description: Between now and March 8th, 2024, the National Institutes of Health (NIH) is seeking public opinion on the ME/CFS (Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome) Roadmap. I encourage everyone to look at the draft research priorities and submit ideas and comments. I describe the process in this video. The link is below. https://ninds.ideascalegov.com/c/campaigns/1286/about An NIH video guide on submitting your ideas and comments: https://ninds.ideascalegov.com/a/pages/mecfsguide - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 004 - Low Dose Naltrexone for the Treatment of Long-COVID

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 004 - Low Dose Naltrexone for the Treatment of Long-COVID
media:group.media:description: In this video, I talk about a treatment that may help reduce Long-COVID symptoms. I was able to download the full article at the link below yesterday, but when I checked today, the article didn't seem to be available in full. - Jarred Younger https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0149291824000031?casa_token=dTEiTgzk73QAAAAA:wj1a8vNxeHTxh0IPSvXfiFz6J3rDpqp9GDyssF70zspt1NbJC2dUlt0RHgu2JsPTPqUVCGM5ntc

entry.title: 003 - Tracking Leukocytes Infiltrating the Brain

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 003 - Tracking Leukocytes Infiltrating the Brain
media:group.media:description: I'm excited to present a new neuroimaging scan that allows us to follow leukocytes (immune cells) that penetrate the blood-brain barrier and infiltrate the brain. I believe this abnormal infiltration of the brain is initiating brain inflammation and causing chronic fatigue, pain, cognitive disorders, mood disorders, and other issues. Watch the video to hear where we are right now in developing this scan - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 002 - New Psilocybin Clinical Trial

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 002 - New Psilocybin Clinical Trial
media:group.media:description: In #2 of this Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue series, I am discussing a new clinical trial using psilocybin for chronic pain. This study will be running throughout 2024. If you are close to the University of Alabama at Birmingham and interested in participating, you can contact us by emailing: youngerlab@uab.edu - Jarred Younger

entry.title: 001 - Introduction

author.name: Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue Lab at UAB

media:group.media:title: 001 - Introduction
media:group.media:description: Welcome to the Neuroinflammation, Pain, and Fatigue series! This is video #1. I'll be releasing videos every week on the newest brain imaging and clinical trial studies, including the most exciting things coming out of my lab. This series is for people with fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis, long-COVID, Gulf War illness, and related chronic pain, fatigue, and cognitive issues. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: Dextromethorphan for Fibromyalgia

media:group.media:title: Dextromethorphan for Fibromyalgia
media:group.media:description: Here is a short description of our Low Dose Dextromethorphan clinical trial for Fibromyalgia, which started in July 2018. Individuals who may have Fibromyalgia and who live within driving distance of Birmingham, Alabama can be screened for the study by completing the online screener at: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1AkyiXyapeWrByZ or by emailing cfs@uab.edu or calling 256-400-3631. - Jarred Younger

entry.title: Do sex hormones influence fibromyalgia?

media:group.media:title: Do sex hormones influence fibromyalgia?
media:group.media:description: Here is a description of our publication examining how sex hormones influence fibromyalgia pain. You can read the full scientific paper at: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1526590017308040?via%3Dihub

media:group.media:title: CFS Subgroups

entry.title: Testing the fibromyalgia immune system with lipopolysaccharide (LPS)

media:group.media:title: Testing the fibromyalgia immune system with lipopolysaccharide (LPS)
media:group.media:description: Here's a quick description of our study happening in summer of 2017 to create an objective test for fibromyalgia! If you have fibromyalgia and can make it to Birmingham, AL for the study, you can learn more by calling 205-530-8006 or emailing youngerlabcytokine@gmail.com

entry.title: Why do we take blood every day?

media:group.media:title: Why do we take blood every day?
media:group.media:description: Thank you everyone who has participated in our daily blood draw study! In this short video I explain why we think it is so important to draw blood frequently in order to find causes of diseases like fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome. If you are interested in filling out our secure, online screening questionnaire to be considered for the study, you can find it at: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1AkyiXyapeWrByZ Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

You can also fill out the online screener by going to the link address below. Be sure to note in the screener that you are interested in the LDN study: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_1AkyiXyapeWrByZ - Jarred Younger Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: CDC Drug List

media:group.media:title: CDC Drug List
media:group.media:description: Here is the list of medications I discussed during the CDC teleconference. This is only a list of medications tested for chronic fatigue syndrome -- most of the drugs do not have sufficient data supporting their use. Please discuss any new treatments with your physician. Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: Q\&A with Dr. Younger: What Research Is Being Done and Will Be Done?

media:group.media:title: Q\&A with Dr. Younger: What Research Is Being Done and Will Be Done?
media:group.media:description: On September 2, 2016, Dr. Jarred Younger, with the Neuroinflammation Pain and Fatigue Lab at UAB (The Younger Lab) answered presubmitted and live questions about his research into ME/CFS (chronic fatigue syndrome), fibromyalgia, Gulf War illness and other complex chronic diseases. He answered the following questions: 1. What details can Dr. Younger give on the interest from pharmaceutical companies in ME/CFS and fibromyalgia? 05:35 2. What are the studies The Younger Lab started this summer? 09:32 3. What is the status of the daily blood draw for ME/CFS study? 12:22 4. Has The Younger Lab received funding for the brain temperature study for ME/CFS? 14:26 5. What is the status of the fibromyalgia alcohol intolerance study?15:16 6. Could there be a connection between the hypometabolic state the Naviaux study found in ME/CFS patients and Dr. Younger's theory of an overly responsive brain immune system causing the disease? 17:49 7. Why did Dr. Younger decide to study botanicals as a possible treatment, and is he going to do any studies with pharmaceuticals? 21:25 8. Can Dr. Younger advise me on what treatment I need for my disease? 24:32 9. What is the status of The Younger Lab's study on ME/CFS and LDN (low-dose Natrexone) and will it include objective measures in that study? 25:11 10. What is The Younger Lab pursuing in it's research: triggers, causes, symptom treatment--how deep is it going to find out the disease process? 28:15 11. How soon will The Younger Lab do a study of botanicals as a treatment for ME/CFS? 30:25 12. How long before The Younger Lab finishes the Gulf War illness botanicals clinical trials study? 32:10 13. Will The Younger Lab be including Korean ginseng in it's botanicals research? 32:20 14. What is the status of the dextromethorphan study and how will it be done and on what disease? 34:00 15. Will The Younger Lab be studying deplin (L-methylfolate)? 35:35 16. Will The Younger Lab be studying the effectiveness of different LDN dosage amounts or considering that variable in it's studies? 37:00 17. What is the status of the immune system tracking study (looking at the immune system and the blood brain barrier)? 40:15 18. Why haven't there been more large-scale studies of LDN in fibromyalgia and other illnesses? 41:45 19. Will The Younger Lab be studying FV100, which has been useful in treating pain in shingles? 44:35 20. Will The Younger Lab be studying Xyrem on fibromyalgia or ME/CFS? 46:40 21. What was the response rate of people with fibromyalgia on LDN and how long does it take to feel the effect, according to The Younger Lab's study? 48:45 22. Will The Younger Lab be studying B12 and cobalamin? 50:40 23. Will The Younger Lab's research include the autonomic or vagal nervous system? 51:40 24. Do any of The Younger Lab's studies include an exercise challenge to see the effect? 54:05 25. Will Dr. Younger be working with Kevin Fontain, at UAB, who has published studies with Dr. Peter Rowe? 54:05 26. What criteria does The Younger Lab use in its ME/CFS studies and what tools does it use to measure symptoms? 56:20 27. Does The Younger Lab exclude depression when it studies ME/CFS? 59:10 28. Does The Younger Lab accept donations for it's research? 1:00:25 29. Does The Younger Lab have a cut off age for study participants? 1:01:40 30. Can people who live in another state participate in The Younger Lab's studies? 1:03:05 31. What should a person do if they tried LDN and it made them worse, does that mean they aren't a match for LDN treatment or should they try it again? 1:08:05 Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: Good news from NIH, and what we need to do going forward

media:group.media:title: Good news from NIH, and what we need to do going forward
media:group.media:description: Today is International Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/ Chronic Fatigue Syndrome and Fibromyalgia Awareness Day. I wanted to share some good news from the National Institutes of Health about new funding, and talk about where we go from here. You can find the NIH funding announcement at: https://grants.nih.gov/grants/guide/notice-files/NOT-AI-16-046.html Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: Q\&A with Dr. Younger: What is Fibromyalgia \& What is ME/CFS - Part II

media:group.media:title: Q\&A with Dr. Younger: What is Fibromyalgia \& What is ME/CFS - Part II
media:group.media:description: Dr. Jarred Younger, from the UAB Neuroinflammation Pain and Fatigue Lab, aka The Younger Lab, takes questions live about fibromyalgia and ME/CFS (chronic fatigue syndrome) and what may be causing the diseases. This is Part II on this subject. Future sessions will include questions about treatments and details about his research. To stay informed, sign up for his newsletter here: http://www.psy.uab.edu/younger/ Below are the questions covered in this session. Click the link at the end of each question to skip to the answer. 1. What one thing would Dr. Younger advise a patient tell a skeptical medical provider about ME/CFS and fibromyalgia? 0:7:10 2. How would Dr. Younger describe to my relatives why I can't function like a healthy person? 0:8:48 3. How often does Dr. Younger see that people with fibromyalgia or ME/CFS also have ADHD? 0:11:22 4. How prevalent is allodynia in The Younger Lab's fibromyalgia population? 0:13:07 5. Is fibromyalgia progressive? 0:16:07 6. If exercise is supposed to help with pain, why does it cause a symptom flare soon afterward? 0:20:30 7. Can a person develop fibromyalgia first and have it evolve into ME/CFS? 0:25:01 8. Since Dr. Younger's theory is that Gulf War illness, fibromyalgia, and ME/CFS are all caused by an oversensitized microglia, then what would explain the different symptoms and different triggers for each of the diseases? 0:27:04 9. Is it possible that vaccines play a role in causing Gulf War illnesses, ME/CFS, or other neuroimmune diseases, such as autism? 0:32:13 10. What does excitotoxicity mean? 0:34:35 11. Dr. Younger's theory is an over sensitization of microglia, part of the immune system. But can the immune system also be deficient, as in low natural killer cells that has been found in ME/CFS? 0:36:06 12. Is the hormone that The Younger Lab found that has the strongest correlation with symptoms, leptin, affected by pregnancy? 0:37:58 13. Do we want the leptin to go up or go down? 0:40:03 14. What is Dr. Younger's theory on how high brain temperature is connected to the symptoms of debilitating fatigue and pain? 0:42:19 15. Could brain inflammation cause the reverse circadian rhythm seen in ME/CFS and fibromyalgia? 0:45:31 16. Some patients have low body temperature. Could this be the body's attempt to lower the brain temperature? 0:46:25 17. Is there a connection between the vagal nerve, the autonomic nervous system, and microglia activity? 0:48:12 18. Does consistent low epinephrine in the urine mean anything clinically or as an indication of disease mechanism? 0:50:17 19. One study showed ME/CFS patients had limited range of motion, whereas another study showed some ME/CFS patients have lax joints. Could range of motion dysfunctions be a stressor on the nervous system, predisposing a person to central sensitazation, or the inflammation signals from nerves in the muscles do it? 0:51:00 20. An Australian study associated chronic pain in women with T cells; does this contradict Dr. Younger's microglia sensitivity study or complement it? Does LDN affect T cells? 0:53:05 21. What is the role of gaba/glutamate balance and kynurenine pathway? 0:54:53 22. Has Dr. Younger found evidence of microtrauma in fibromyalgia patients, as is seen in post-concussion syndrome? 0:57:46 Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: Do you have a hot brain?

media:group.media:title: Do you have a hot brain?
media:group.media:description: In this video we are discussing a new imaging technique that allows us to measure the temperature of the brain. We will be using this scan to better understand fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome, multiple sclerosis, traumatic brain injury, rheumatoid arthritis, depression, and other conditions. The link to the online screening form is: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/SE/?SID=SV_1AkyiXyapeWrByZ You can follow the lab news on our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Neuroinflammation-Pain-and-Fatigue-Laboratory-at-UAB-1543963919214695/?fref=nf Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: Testing nine potential treatments for Gulf War Illness pain and fatigue

media:group.media:title: Testing nine potential treatments for Gulf War Illness pain and fatigue
media:group.media:description: Information about our new study for Gulf War Illness where we study nine different potential treatments. Individuals who were in the 1990-1991 Persian Gulf War and who live in Alabama can fill out the online screening form at: https://uab.co1.qualtrics.com/SE/?SID=SV_eRk8ChC3GkOIpQF Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger

entry.title: What is neuroinflammation?

media:group.media:title: What is neuroinflammation?
media:group.media:description: A short video explaining the general concept of neuroinflammation and how it may drive pain, fatigue and other chronic conditions. Here is a link to our website: https://cas.uab.edu/younger
